snippet: Because of a refereeing mistake late in a game between Locust Grove and Frederick A. Douglass high schools, Oklahoma’s Class 3A playoffs hinge on a judge’s decision.
abstract: Class 3A football playoffs for Oklahoma's midsize schools are being delayed until district judge upholds or invalidates Locust Grove's disputed quarterfinal victory Nov 28 over Frederick A Douglass High School of Oklahoma City; Douglass wants game partly or entirely replayed because of critical, admitted error made by referees in negating late touchdown.
lead_paragraph: Because of a refereeing mistake late in a game between Locust Grove and Frederick A. Douglass high schools, Oklahoma’s Class 3A playoffs hinge on a judge’s decision.

headline.seo: Court Weighs Intervening in Oklahoma High School Football Playoffs
headline.main: After Referees Blunder, Next Call Is a Judge’s
headline.print_headline: After Referees Blunder, Next Call Is a Judge’s
